anatomy.distinction: More central than marginal artery of Drummond

marginal_artery_of_drummond.location: Runs along bowel wall at mesenteric border
marginal_artery_of_drummond.pathway: Connects vasa recta along entire colon

clinical_significance.collateral_function: Connects SMA and IMA territories - bidirectional flow

AAA_repair.IMA_reimplantation: Consider if arc of Riolan/meandering artery is dominant
AAA_repair.preop_assessment: Large meandering artery = IMA important for left colon

mesenteric_ischemia.protection: Provides collateral in SMA or IMA occlusion
mesenteric_ischemia.limitation: May be insufficient for acute occlusion

imaging.meandering_artery_sign: Enlarged tortuous vessel indicates chronic occlusion upstream

definition.@value: A direct arterial connection between superior and inferior mesenteric artery territories via the middle colic and left colic arteries, located centrally in the mesentery, providing collateral flow in mesenteric occlusion.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the arc of Riolan and its anatomic course
Differentiate from marginal artery of Drummond
Understand implications for AAA repair and IMA management
clinical_pearls: Arc of Riolan is CENTRAL, marginal artery of Drummond is PERIPHERAL (along bowel)
Meandering mesenteric artery = chronic occlusion somewhere - find it!
During AAA repair, large meandering artery = consider IMA reimplantation
Griffiths point (splenic flexure) and Sudeck point (rectosigmoid) are watershed zones
Arc of Riolan present in 50-70% but usually small - enlarges with disease
